clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Standing Frame on Constipation in Children With Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Standing Frame on Constipation in Children With Cerebral Palsy: a Single Subject Study

collaborator.agency: Azienda Unita' Sanitaria Locale Di Modena

clinical_study.source: University of Modena and Reggio Emilia

brief_summary.textblock:
Children with Cerebral Palsy and quadriplegia or severe diplegia suffer from highly reduced mobility and consequent constipation. Clinicians frequently recommend standing-frames to exercise the support reaction in this population, sharing the opinion that the upright position may facilitate intestinal transit, although no evidence supports this assumption.
The investigators conducted this single-subject research to determine the effects of the standing-frame on the frequency of evacuation in chronically constipated children with CP and quadriplegia.
Moreover, the investigators studied its effects on the frequency of induction of evacuation, the characteristics of the stool and the pain suffered by the child due to constipation and/or evacuation.

primary_outcome.description: Using a daily-diary where the caregivers collect the data about the bowel evacuation frequency

secondary_outcome.description: Using a daily-diary where the caregivers collect the data about the bowel evacuation inductions frequency

other_outcome.measure: pain related to the bowel evacuation
other_outcome.description: Using a daily-diary where the caregivers collect the data about the pain related to the bowel evacuation
Using a daily-diary where the caregivers collect the data about the distress of the caregiver

arm_group.description: In this study we included children with CP, in the manifestation of severe diplegia or quadriplegia, who do not currently use the standing-frame.

study_pop.textblock: In this study we included children with CP, in the manifestation of severe diplegia or quadriplegia, who do not currently use the standing-frame. The population of interest might be referred to the Unit for severe disability in developmental age or to one of the neuro-psychiatric and rehabilitation Units of the area of Modena and Reggio Emilia, (5.000 km2 of surface and 1.250.000 inhabitants)
